about.title: +about
about.content: EV Ceramics is a ceramic studio run by Emilie Vizcano. All the pieces she makes are handmade, one by one, using the modelling technique. What she likes is for the object not to lose its natural character and for us to see the traces of the creation process, inspired by the japanese Wabi Sabi concept. Another of her aims is for the object itself to be beautiful, and she likes to think that if it doesn't fulfil its main function, it becomes a piece of decoration.

wabi-sabi.title: +wabi sabi
wabi-sabi.content-1: Wabi-sabi is a Japanese concept that celebrates the beauty of imperfection, transience and simplicity in life and art. It has its roots in Zen Buddhism and the Japanese tea tradition. This philosophy encourages us to find beauty in modest objects and experiences, often marked by time and use.
wabi-sabi.content-2: Wabi-sabi values imperfections, irregularities and asymmetries, believing they add depth and authenticity. It invites us to embrace change and accept the inevitable passage of time. Simplicity, sobriety and modesty are key elements, encouraging us to turn away from pomp and ostentation.
